meanings.definition: The quality or state of being slow or sluggish.
meanings.sent1: The lentor of the turtle's movements made it easy to catch.
meanings.sent2: The lentor of the traffic made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent3: The lentor of the sloth's pace was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move with lentor as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The lentor of the snail's crawl was mesmerizing to observe.

meanings.definition: A sluggish or slow movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The lentor of the river's flow indicated a dry season.
meanings.sent2: The lentor of the old clock's hands showed it needed winding.
meanings.sent3: The lentor of the sloth's climb up the tree was amusing to witness.
meanings.sent4: The lentor of progress in the project frustrated the team.
meanings.sent5: The lentor of the caterpillar's crawl fascinated the children.
